body_html:
One needs to install docker in the container. Therefore the environment was not set up properly so @gunan was right.

For example and depending on your machine:

$ apt-get update && \
    apt-get install \
    apt-transport-https \
    ca-certificates \
    curl \
    software-properties-common && \
    curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | apt-key add - && \
    add-apt-repository "deb [arch=amd64] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu \
    $(lsb_release -cs) stable" && \
    apt-get install docker-ce

$which docker

/usr/bin/docker

I'm still stalled, suggest you check out #13784 if there is anything you can contribute, don't forget to edit the readme file everytime you validate a solution. This repo has way too many contributors and no proper documentation.

body:
One needs to [install docker](https://docs.docker.com/engine/installation/linux/docker-ce/ubuntu/#set-up-the-repository) in the container. Therefore the environment was not set up properly so @gunan was right.

For example and depending on your machine:

```
$ apt-get update && \
    apt-get install \
    apt-transport-https \
    ca-certificates \
    curl \
    software-properties-common && \
    curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | apt-key add - && \
    add-apt-repository "deb [arch=amd64] https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu \
    $(lsb_release -cs) stable" && \
    apt-get install docker-ce
```

`$which docker`
> /usr/bin/docker

I'm still stalled, suggest you check out #13784 if there is anything you can contribute, don't forget to edit the readme file everytime you validate a solution. This repo has way too many contributors and no proper documentation.
